fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A list of flood-threatened locations on England’s east coast to which the Environment Agency had moved temporary barriers and pumps included “Blythe”. We meant Blyth, in Northumberland. The error originated in a list provided by the Environment Agency (Snow and flood warnings as storms hit UK, 13 January, page 3). • An editing error resulted in an article about cover bands referring to Oasish’s “tense recreation of the famous 1995 chart battle with Blurd” in 2014. The battle was with Blurb, a different Blur tribute act (When cover bands come out of the shadows, 16 January, page 3, G2). • Homophone corner: “the two leaders poured over maps and tackled the thorny question of land swaps and percentages on the wartorn island” (UK joins push to restore peace to Cyprus, 12 January, page 17).
